Yes, there are several student-led societies at the University of Nottingham that focus on environmentalism and sustainability. Here are some examples of the societies available:

1. People & Planet Society: This is a student-led group that focuses on environmental and social justice campaigns. The group seeks to promote sustainable living and encourage wider societal change towards a more sustainable and equitable future.

2. Wildlife and Conservation Society: This group aims to promote an understanding of conservation issues and encourage the conservation of wildlife and habitats on a local and global level. They organize events, workshops, and field trips to engage with the outdoors and raise awareness on biodiversity and conservation.

3. Sustainable Travel Society: This society works towards promoting sustainable travel options within the university and wider community, including cycling, walking, and public transport. In addition, they engage with the local community and tackle issues such as air pollution and reducing the carbon footprint of travel.

These societies provide students with opportunities to learn about and take action on important environmental issues, engage with like-minded individuals, and make a positive impact on the world around them. There are also many other student-led societies at the university that focus on sustainability, environmentalism, and activism. You can explore the full list of societies on the university website and find out more about how to get involved with the groups that interest you.
